ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.2_0: the monks from the group of seventeen were playing in the water of the river Aciravatī.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.3_0: Just then King Pasenadi of Kosala was up in his best stilt house with queen Mallikā
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.4_0: and he saw the monks from the group of seventeen playing in the river.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.6_0: “Mallikā, these perfected ones are playing in the water.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.7_0: “Great king, the training rule has not been laid down by the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.8_0: Either that, or these monks are ignorant of the rules.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.10_0: “How can the Buddha find out about these monks playing in the water without me telling him?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.11_0: King Pasenadi then summoned those monks and gave them a large lump of sugar, saying,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.12_0: “Venerable Sir, please give this sugar to the Buddha.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.13_0: The monks from the group of seventeen went to that Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.15_0: “Venerable Sir, this lump of sugar is a gift from King Pasenadi.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.16_0: “But, monks, where did you see the king?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.17_0: “From the river Aciravatī, while we were playing in the water.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.19_0: “... Foolish men, how can you play in water?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.20_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.21_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.22.1_0: ‘If a monk plays in water, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.1.2_0: if, aiming to have fun, he immerses himself or emerges on the surface or swims, in water which is more than ankle deep, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.1_0: If he is playing in water, and he perceives that he is, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.2_0: If he is playing in water, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.3_0: If he is playing in water, but he does not perceive that he is, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.4_0: If he is playing in water less than ankle deep, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.5_0: If he is playing with a boat in water, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.6_0: If he makes it move with his hand or foot, there is an offense of wrong conduct for washing the feet or a fist in water, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.7_0: If he plays with water, conjee, milk, buttermilk, dye, urine, or mud, in a vessel, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.8_0: If he is not playing in water, but he perceives that he is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.9_0: If he is not playing in water, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.10_0: If he is not playing in water, and he does not perceive that he is, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.2_0: if he is not aiming to have fun;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.3_0: if he stands or has to be done; or he wakes up or plunges into the water;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.4_0: while going beyond the far shore, or sink in the ocean.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.7_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.8_0: The third rule, the training rule on playing, is finished.
